snippet: New York City will receive $1.77 billion of the $5.4 billion installment; New York State, $1.71 billion; and other states will split the rest, Senator Charles E. Schumer said.
abstract: Federal officials plan to release first installment of nearly $51 billion emergency aid package to help millions of victims of Hurricane Sandy in Northeast; New York City will receive $1.77 billion; New York State, $1.71 billion; New Jersey, $1.82 billion; and Connecticut, Maryland and Rhode Island splitting the rest of the $5.4 billion installment.
lead_paragraph: New York City will receive $1.77 billion of the $5.4 billion installment; New York State, $1.71 billion; and other states will split the rest, Senator Charles E. Schumer said.

headline.seo: First Part of Hurricane Sandy Aid Is to Be Released
headline.main: U.S. to Release First Installment of $51 Billion in Hurricane Sandy Aid
headline.print_headline: U.S. to Release First Part Of $51 Billion in Storm Aid
